sections.heading: Output Variables
sections.description: The Python print() function is often used to output variables. In the print() function, you output multiple variables, separated by a comma: You can also use the + operator to output multiple variables: For numbers, the + character works as a mathematical operator: In the print() function, when you try to combine a string and a number with the + operator, Python will give you an error: The best way to output multiple variables in the print() function is to separate them with commas, which even support different data types:

code_blocks.code:
x = "Python"
y = "is"
z = "awesome"
print(x, y, z)

x = "Python "
y = "is "
z = "awesome"
print(x
»»+ y + z)
